title: Sudden Unilateral Sensorineural Hearing Loss
chief_complaint: I woke up two days ago and realized I couldn't hear out of my right ear. I also have ringing and a feeling of fullness in that ear.

problem_summary.onset: Sudden onset upon waking in the morning, 2 days prior to the visit.
problem_summary.associated_symptoms: Tinnitus (ringing) and aural fullness in the right ear. Denies dizziness.
problem_summary.functional_impact: Inability to hear in the right ear.
problem_summary.goals_motivation: Referred by urgent care for ENT consult and audiologic evaluation.

history.present_illness: Patient presented to urgent care 2 days ago after waking up with right-sided hearing loss, tinnitus, and fullness. He drove himself to the appointment. He is now referred for specialty evaluation.
history.prior_management: Seen by urgent care physician 2 days ago.
history.patient_goals: Diagnosis and management of the sudden hearing loss.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Right ear shows a moderate to moderately-severe sensorineural hearing loss with a flat configuration (thresholds approx. 50-60 dB HL). Bone conduction matches air conduction. Left ear thresholds are within normal limits (0-10 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.key_findings: Word recognition is excellent in the left ear but significantly reduced (poor) in the right ear, even at high presentation levels.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.key_findings: Waveforms are present for the Right ear at 90, 80, and 65 dB nHL. (Note: Specific wave labeling and IPL calculation are student tasks in the source material).

overall_audiologic_summary: The evaluation reveals a sudden, unilateral, moderate-to-moderately severe sensorineural hearing loss in the right ear. Speech understanding in the right ear is disproportionately poor (32%) relative to the degree of pure-tone loss. The left ear presents with normal hearing sensitivity and excellent speech recognition. Tympanometry is normal bilaterally, ruling out middle ear pathology.
counseling_points: The results confirm a significant hearing loss in your right ear that comes from the inner ear or nerve (sensorineural).
Because this happened suddenly, it is treated as a medical urgency.
Your ability to understand speech in the right ear is quite poor, even when sounds are made loud.
It is important to proceed with the ENT consultation immediately to discuss treatment options, such as steroid therapy.
notes_for_actor: Portray a patient who is anxious about the sudden loss of hearing.
Emphasize that there was no dizziness, only the hearing loss, ringing, and fullness.
You noticed the problem immediately upon waking up.
